result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber E. Bertsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: All obligations placed on payment plan $25 per month beginning 9/6/16

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
NO CONTACT WITH SHAWNA FORD
NO association with methamphetamine users, including those that have been charged with a methamphetamine offense and/or the defendant knows is a methamphetamine user except in a group therapy setting.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail within 10 days.

Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Make an appointment with Sandy Principe today.

judgments.dispoDesc: probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 262 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Concurrent with: 15CF172, 15CF205 and 18CM45 but Consecutive to 16CF168, 16CF279 and 16CF322

superMiscConds.notes: To seek, obtain and maintain half time employment and until such time provide 3 work searches per week.

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any  mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Defendant is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold  there.
  The defendant is ordered to random drug testing.
  Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting, meeting, or in a correctional setting.
NO CONTACT with Joni Dashner or their residence or places where they are present
NO CONTACT with Shawna Ford or their residence or places where they are present
NO CONTACT with Bonnie Claremboux or their residence or places where they are present
Pay financial obligations as previously determined though the DOC.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant Amber E. Bertsch in court with attorney Jennifer Gross.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF172,15CF205,15CF151 and 18CM45-- offer to settle and SAR recommendation is the agreement of the parties with amendment to Ct 4. Def pleads NC to Count 2 in 18CM45, Count 1 is DRI. Signed PQ. took pres as pres, understands elements of the crime. Wants Ct to accept pleas, Ct accepts pleas and finds G. State comments on sentencing and State complied with Vic rights. Atty comments on sentencing. CT comments on sentencing. 
Ct orders-- see offer to settle.

Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for Defendant Amber E. Bertsch. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Amber E. Bertsch appeared by video means. Atty comments- def does not wish to withdraw her plea at this time. Need more time to get the credit for time served..  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
Offer to settle and SAR recommendation
of right to seek postconviction

Defendant Amber E. Bertsch in court with attorney Jennifer Gross.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF151,15CF172,15CF205- Cases are set for a SEHR.  18CM45 set for a PLEAS.  Offers to settle and SAR recommendation is the agreement of the parties. 18CM45- understands charge and potential penalties. PLEADS NC to count 2. admits she is a repeater. 18CM45 Count 1 is DRI. 18CM45- signed PQ. Understands elements of the crime. Wants Ct to accept pleas of NC and the agreement of the parties. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. State complied with Vic rights- no response. 946(1) 936(1)(a)- Credit for time served on 18CM45-any time before offense is not able to use. 149 days for credit on the open case. State asking for Ct to look at the SAR ROW-- the credit that was given on that letter. Off record- Back on the record- 10:37am-- State asking to reconvene- Def thinks she has more credit. State would like to talk with Tony Jones, Atty is fine with adj hearings  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
Sent e-mail to jail letting them know def needs to be here on July 20 by 9:50 a.m.  ka
